title: Report: Eagles approach Jason Peters about a pay cut
text:
Report: Eagles approach Jason Peters about a pay cut Peters has a cap number of $11.7 million in 2017. Slot to Philadelphia Links 
The Philadelphia Eagles have made their first crucial decision of the offseason. 
According to an ESPN report , the Eagles approached longtime left tackle Jason Peters about taking a pay cut for 2017. Peters, 35, has a cap hit of $11.2 million and a base salary set at $10.45 million. Both are the highest on the team. 
The Eagles are expected to start a salary cap purge this month in order to create enough salary cap space to sign a wide receiver or two in free agency. Restructuring Peters's contract is the first step. 
The Philadelphia Eagles have a crucial offseason ahead of them as the franchise looks to return to the playoffs for the first time since 2013. Make sure to stay in the loop for all Eagles transactions this offseason -- take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Eagles newsletter now! 
Philadelphia would save $9.2 million by simply releasing Peters this offseason, but he is coming off a Pro Bowl season in which he allowed just one sack over his final 13 games, earning a grade of 88.3 by Pro Football Focus (seventh among all tackles). 
Peters is a nine-time Pro Bowler and a six-time All Pro heading into his 14th NFL season. He earned a $500,000 roster bonus for making the Pro Bowl in 2016.
